title: Erigon not in sync after restart
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`
v2.52.5

OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX
Image from https://hub.docker.com/r/thorax/erigon/ running in Google Kubernetes Engine
Commit hash:   git_branch=heads/v2.52.5 git_tag=v2.52.5-dirty git_commit=7c5e4e770f122299c34a9309a37a33a146443da8

Erigon Command (with flags/config):
erigon 
--chain=bor-mainnet 
--datadir=/data/ 
--http.addr=0.0.0.0 
--http.vhosts=* 
--http 
--http.api=eth,admin,debug,net,trace,web3,erigon,txpool 
--ws 
--bor.heimdall=http://heimdallrest 
--authrpc.vhosts=* 
--authrpc.jwtsecret=/secret/jwt.hex 
--authrpc.addr=0.0.0.0 
--db.size.limit=8TB 
--maxpeers=500 
--torrent.download.rate=300mb 
--bootnodes=enode://bdcd4786a616a853b8a041f53496d853c68d99d54ff305615cd91c03cd56895e0a7f6e9f35dbf89131044e2114a9a782b792b56
61e3aff07faf125a98606a071@43.200.206.40:30303,enode://209aaf7ed549cf4a5700fd833da25413f80a1248bd3aa7fe2a87203e3f7b236dd729579e5c8df61c97bf508281bae4969d6de76a7393bcbd04a0af70270333b3@54.216.248.9:30303

Consensus Layer:
heimdall

Consensus Layer Command (with flags/config):


Chain/Network: 
polygon mainnet

#### Expected behaviour
We are able to scale down the pod to 0. Wehen we scale up again erigon will be in sync again pretty fast.
The write-IOPS of the disk were around 40k to 60k while erigon was in sync with spikes to 78k.


#### Actual behaviour
After the reboot erigon is not getting in sync again. At first it logged ETL messages but even after one complete cycle with all stages it is not getting the speed it had before the restart. Right now it again is logging ETL info messages.


#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
Hava an erigon instance in sync. Stop the instance. Start the instance.

#### Backtrace
This is an extract from logs where I searched for the following:
"RPC Daemon" OR "] DONE" OR "] Processed" OR "[ERROR]" OR "Slower" OR "clos" OR "git_branch"

With the close and git_branch info messages we can see the stop and start.
We only stopped the instance to make a disk snapshot. We did not change anything during the down time.

